intro: Apinella dufourii, commonly known as the Dufour's apinella, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Apinella dufourii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological role in its native environment.
